symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.pattern: Present in a significant portion of cases (e.g., 68.8% in one study)

symptoms.name: Vomiting
symptoms.pattern: Present in a significant portion of cases (e.g., 57.6% in one study)

symptoms.name: Abdominal pain
symptoms.pattern: Present in a portion of cases (e.g., 36.1% in one study), can lead to hospitalization

symptoms.name: Nausea
symptoms.pattern: Present in a portion of cases (e.g., 25.7% in one study)

vital_signs.description: Not explicitly detailed in provided text, but abnormal liver function tests are a key indicator.

AST.abnormal_range: >500 IU/L (in some studies, used as a diagnostic criterion)

ALT.abnormal_range: >500 IU/L (in some studies, used as a diagnostic criterion)

risk_factors: Adenovirus infection (particularly adenovirus type 41 species F)
SARS-CoV-2 infection (potential role in priming the immune system for subsequent liver damage)

required: AST or ALT > 500 IU/L (in some studies)
supportive: Negative testing for hepatitis A, B, C, and E viruses
Positive testing for adenovirus (especially Ad-F41) or SARS-CoV-2
